content: Healthcare Lifestyle Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 06 Jun 2018Is it wise to buy $10k worth of health products including $10k worth of this health products shares (their share name is Noble Vici)?11 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (11)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Ck ChaiLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 08 Jun 2018Not sure how much you know about the company.  When googled around, there isn't much info of the company.  And looking at their  corporate website profile, there is totally no mention of health products related biz under their biz stream. https://www.noblevici.com/about-us​Personally, I do not feel comfortable in investing, you may want to find out more of the company and consider the possible risk before jumping into investing.0 comments1

Charmaine NgLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 07 Jun 2018I've googled around and it seems there's no mention of healthcare products linked with the company.. what's more the company seems to be listed very recently with high votality. ​When investing I believe it's important to do your own homework; know what they are doing for sustainable growth and take a leap of faith if necessary.​Personally I'm not comfortable and would advise you not to but if you know them well personally and believe these are legit investments with sustainable growth then go for it. Also please do make sure the health products have gone through stringent quality checks and suitable for whoever is going to consume them. It is never worth it if you invest 10k for health products you will not be using.. do not let that be a bait.​https://sg.finance.yahoo.com/news/noble-vici-group-inc-otcmkts-043300369.html0 comments1

Gabriel ThamLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 06 Jun 2018Do you know much about this company?​I personally do not and looking at the website I don't feel comfortable.  ​However, the decision lies with you as it is your money. All investments come with risk. Are you ok with the risk and worst case scenarios?0 comments1

Jonathan Chia Guangrong, Fund Manager at JCG FundLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 17 Sep 2018How did you get to know of this companuy? Hot tip from a friend / family?  What can you hope to achieve from the purchase and holding of these health products/shares?  For non listed investments, I'd suggest staying far far away, unless you know the company inside out and are comfortable investing with them. Even then, invest only with funds that you are ok to lose, which you won't leave sleep over.​If you are new to investing, do read up materials available to get a sense of what investing entails, ask about the community here as well if you need help understanding. All the best.0 comments0

HC Tang, Financial Enthusiast, Budgeting at The SocietyLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 16 Sep 2018​It's very weird why health product ??? when over their homepage and fb says: ​We are the investment holding company of several leading fintech and analytic technology-related subsidiaries; consisting of research & development, market analytics and e-commerce.  We are distinctive in our abilities to develop integrated ecosystems leveraging Blockchain Technologies, supporting both business and consumer marketplaces.  Headquartered in Singapore and listed in America, our operations spans across Asia PacificI see them more of a fintech /blockchain investment company, like angel investors etc. I wouldn't brush them off too quickly. However, I wouldn't buy any health product from them at all, because it doesn't seems to be relate. Furthermore, 10k worth ??? (How long can it last ??) ​Can google and observe some time on what company did they actually invest in,  if those company has good product fundamentals, mostly could be fintech / blockchain, it will then for you to decide if want to invest in because the tech is still new and no sure of their execution capabilities to keep the startup that they invested in to becomes a decent company that will stays for long.  0 comments0
Nicholas ChanLevel 5. GeniusAnswered on 16 Sep 2018Sounds like a MLM company. Be wary. 0 comments0
Jay Liu, Diploma in Accountancy  at KHEALevel 6. MasterAnswered on 16 Sep 2018Will you be ok if the price drops to half of what you bought the next day? 0 comments0

Gabriel LeeLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 16 Sep 2018Don't think it's a wise decision to invest so much into this company and it's health products which you are unfamiliar with. Do also diversify your investments to minimise the risk taken 0 comments0
Good Day Every DayLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 16 Sep 2018No, it is not advisable to put all your eggs in one basket. 0 comments0

MasterAnswered on 16 Sep 2018I think it is wiser to stick with known brands for supplements but ... why spend so much on health products !? ​Eat in morderation and exercise ​stocks wise I think it would be better to first do deeper research 0 comments0
Hannah FooLevel 3. WonderkidAnswered on 17 Jun 2018For shares, I guess it's still better (and safer) to stick to blue chips. I will not buy something that I've not heard of before.0 comments0
